## 1. Summary
The chat primarily focused on new features and technical implementations in Hyperfy. Ashxn shared significant updates including head tracking/gaze functionality, a customizable emote wheel with hotkeys, and improvements to animation systems. HiroP demonstrated an impressive AI integration allowing voice-controlled object manipulation in-world. Several developers discussed elevator physics, with Gert-Jan Akerboom working on making elevators function globally despite some shakiness issues. There was technical discussion about skinned mesh animations and their implementation. 0mka shared work on a gold collection system with persistent storage tied to player IDs and instanced chests. Shaw inquired about procedural terrain generation, with Ashxn explaining the differences between apps (which have limited but portable API access) and custom systems (which can use raw Three.js functionality). The conversation highlighted Hyperfy's ongoing development with particular emphasis on immersion-enhancing features and the balance between API limitations and forward compatibility.
